org.beiter.michael.authn.jaas.common

Class CommonProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.beiter.michael.authn.jaas.common.CommonProperties

  • public class CommonProperties
extends Object
    This class specifies database properties.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CommonProperties()
      Constructs an empty set of JAAS common properties, with most values being set to null, 0, or empty (depending on the type of the property).
      CommonProperties(CommonProperties properties)
      Creates a set of common properties from an existing set of common properties, making a defensive copy.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommonProperties

        public CommonProperties()
        Constructs an empty set of JAAS common properties, with most values being set to null, 0, or empty (depending on the type of the property). Usually this constructor is used if this configuration POJO is populated in an automated fashion (e.g. injection). If you need to build them manually (possibly with defaults), use or create a properties builder.

        You can change the defaults with the setters.

        See Also:
        JaasBasedCommonPropsBuilder.buildDefault(), JaasBasedCommonPropsBuilder.build(java.util.Map)

      • CommonProperties

        public CommonProperties(CommonProperties properties)
        Creates a set of common properties from an existing set of common properties, making a defensive copy.
        Parameters:
        properties - The set of properties to copy
        See Also:
        CommonProperties()

      • getAdditionalProperties

        public final Map<String,String> getAdditionalProperties()
        Returns:
        Any additional properties stored in this object that have not explicitly been parsed
        See Also:
        CommonProperties#setAdditionalProperties(Map)

      • setAdditionalProperties

        public final void setAdditionalProperties(Map<String,String> additionalProperties)
        Any additional properties which have not been parsed, and for which no getter/setter exists, but are to be stored in this object nevertheless.

        This property is commonly used to preserve original properties from upstream components that are to be passed on to downstream components unchanged. This properties set may or may not include properties that have been extracted from the map, and been made available through this POJO.

        Note that these additional properties may be null or empty, even in a fully populated POJO where other properties commonly have values assigned to.

        Parameters:
        additionalProperties - The additional properties to store
